Person.Organization: AMERICAN SOCIETY FOR BONE & MINERAL RESHEBREW REHABILITATION CENTER FOR AGEDBROAD INSTITUTE, INC.

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The data used for the analyses described in this paper were obtained from the database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP), at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap. Genotype and phenotype data for the Bone Microarchitecture Study were provided by Dr. Douglas Kiel of Hebrew SeniorLife and Harvard Medical School. Funding support for the original Study was provided by the US National Institutes of Health. The original Study drew on subject cohorts recruited at the Mayo Clinic (S. Khosla, Rochester MN, USA), INSERM (R. Chapurlat, P. Szulc, Lyon, France) and Geneva University (S. Ferrari, Geneva, Switzerland). Original recruitment and characterization of subjects was supported by the US National Institutes of Health, INSERM, Swiss Foundation for Research in Aging, Geneva University, and BNP-Paribas Foundation.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical
ConsentGroup.name: HMB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Osteoporosis, IRB, COL, GSO, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-OSP-IRB-COL-GSO-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Osteoporosis and related disorders. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Requestor must provide a letter of collaboration with the primary study investigator(s). Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only.
Data use is limited to study of osteoporosis and other bone diseases. Documentation of a collaborative agreement with Dr. Serge L. Ferrari at Geneva University must be provided; please contact Dr. Ferrari at: Serge L. Ferrari, M.D. Division of Bone Diseases Department of Rehabilitation and Geriatrics Geneva University Hospital and Faculty of Medicine 1211 GE 14 Switzerland Serge.Ferrari@unige.ch
